author: cnbc.com
title: Oversea Casing Company Acquires DeWied International
text:
New entity poised to become dominant casing supplier to small, medium, and large sausage manufacturers in North America and around the world
SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Oversea Casing Company, LLC announced today that it has completed the acquisition of DeWied International Inc. and will be operating under the new name Oversea DeWied International LLC.
Michael Mayo, CEO, said, “We are very excited about our future and can’t wait to leverage the synergies from combining the talent, experience, technology, and passion of both companies.”
Both Oversea Casing and DeWied International are currently among the top players in the industry and have combined experience of more than 176 years in the natural casing trade. The new strategy is simply to build on the employee expertise, outstanding products, and the expanded reach to better serve both existing and new business partners.
This acquisition puts Oversea DeWied International in line with the consolidation trend in the sausage casing industry. When merged, the new entity will maintain headquarters in Seattle, Washington, subsidiaries in San Antonio, Texas, Mexico City, Mexico, British Columbia, Canada, and Jiangsu province, China, as well as a state of the art production facility in Piedras Negras, Mexico. Combined total employees will top out over 125 not including contractors.
“This bigger and stronger base of operations will help facilitate several initiatives,” Mayo said. “We will be better able to quickly and effectively conduct business across the entire North American continent, as well as internationally, utilizing many economies of scale that will make us more efficient and ultimately more profitable.”
Total production and distribution will more than double upon completion of the deal. According to David Mayo, VP of Sales, “Oversea Casing and DeWied will serve our customers with the biggest and best sales and customer service team in North America. Increased production across all product lines including hog casings, sheep casings and artificial casings will allow for exponential growth.”
Howard de Wied, President and CEO of DeWied International said, “Oversea Casing was by far the best partner to join forces with. Our family business has always deeply cared about our customers, vendors and employees and the team at Oversea Casing shares these core values. We are confident we are leaving our stakeholders in good hands.”
As a result of this acquisition, Oversea DeWied International will become the largest American owned casing company, and with strong partners and contractors on the supply, production and distribution side, they will be poised to make a mark in the sausage casing industry, both domestically and internationally.
